title: Eddie Van Halen 'battling throat cancer which he thinks is from guitar pick'
text:
The songwriter blames his guitar pick (Picture: Getty)

Eddie Van Halen has been secretly battling throat cancer for several years and the songwriter believes it comes from sucking on his metal guitar pick.

The Van Halen rocker was apparently diagnosed back in 2000 and has been flying back and forth between the USA and Germany for five years for the treatment.

Eddie, 64, has been a heavy smoker for a long time but he thinks the cancer stems from holding the plectrum in his mouth while rocking out on stage.

He had a third of his tongue removed and was given the all-clear in 2002.

TMZ reported that his current treatment has been keeping the disease ‘in check’, but it is unsure whether he will be given the all-clear.

The last time Van Halen performed together in 2015, he said: ‘I used metal picks – they’re brass and copper – which I always held in my mouth, in the exact place where I got the tongue cancer.

Eddie on stage in Chicago in 1979 (Picture: Paul Natkin/Getty Images)

‘Plus, I basically live in a recording studio that’s filled with electromagnetic energy. So that’s one theory.

‘I mean, I was smoking and doing a lot of drugs and a lot of everything. But at the same time, my lungs are totally clear. This is just my own theory, but the doctors say it’s possible.’

However, Eddie has yet to comment on the reports made by multiple outlets.

Van Halen released their self-titled album in 1978 and proceeded to become one of the biggest rockbands in the ’80s.

They were best known for Jump and Why Can’t This Be Love.

Metro.co.uk have contacted reps of Eddie for comment.
